headline: Lowe’s trims corporate workforce amid strategic pivot - Report
summary: Investing.com -- Lowe’s Companies Inc. has initiated a workforce reduction affecting approximately 600 corporate and support positions. According to reporting from The Charlotte Observer, the Mooresville-based retail giant confirmed the layoffs on Friday as part of a broader organizational realigned. The job cuts represent less than 1% of the company’s total workforce of 300,000 employees. “We have made the difficult decision to reduce approximately 600 corporate and support roles,” the company

headline: Lowe’s Is Cutting 600 Corporate and Support Jobs
summary: Lowe’s is eliminating about 600 corporate and support roles, the company said Friday, making it the second major big-box retailer to announce layoffs this week.  “This step helps better align our resources to support our stores and the associates who serve customers every day,” according to a company statement.  The cuts represent less than 1% of the North Carolina-based retailer’s total workforce, and a Lowe’s spokeswoman said it will provide support including career transition resources.

headline: Retail Sector Steps Into The Earnings Spotlight, What To Watch For In Q4 Reports
summary: The retail industry can be cyclical, and right now, the outlook isn't too great. Find out why consumers are still reluctant to spend and are worried about the future
